pullrequest.title: Adding a K-Means clustering algorithm to math

content.raw: `_k` can't be less than zero.
content.html: _k can't be less than zero.

pullrequest.title: Adding a K-Means clustering algorithm to math

content.raw: I've changed the parameter to accept an `int` but it's open for discussion. The problem with the `unsigned int` is that the user can pass a negative number and it will be interpreted as a positive one. We won't be able to detect the situation. With an `int` at least we can control the wrong cases.
content.html: I've changed the parameter to accept an int but it's open for discussion. The problem with the unsigned int is that the user can pass a negative number and it will be interpreted as a positive one. We won't be able to detect the situation. With an int at least we can control the wrong cases.

pullrequest.title: Adding a K-Means clustering algorithm to math

content.raw: I haven't tested this, but you could use `std::random_shuffle` to randomize `this->obs` and then take the first `this->k` elements.
content.html: I haven't tested this, but you could use std::random_shuffle to randomize this->obs and then take the first this->k elements.

pullrequest.title: Adding a K-Means clustering algorithm to math

content.raw: I like it but it has one problem. The output of `Cluster()` has `_labels`. For each element `i` in `this->obs`, `_labels` stores the cluster to which `this->obs[i]` belongs. If we shuffle `this->obs` internally, the element `i` of labels won't match the element `i` of `this->obs`.
content.html: I like it but it has one problem. The output of Cluster() has _labels. For each element i in this->obs, _labels stores the cluster to which this->obs[i] belongs. If we shuffle this->obs internally, the element i of labels won't match the element i of this->obs.

pullrequest.title: Adding a K-Means clustering algorithm to math

content.raw:
`const` function.

To match other functions in Gazebo, use `GetClusterCount`. When porting to ignition, remove the `Get` (which you can do here as well if you want).
content.html:
const function.

To match other functions in Gazebo, use GetClusterCount. When porting to ignition, remove the Get (which you can do here as well if you want).

`SetClusterCount`

SetClusterCount
